thread.title: Pastors want special session in Kentucky over gay marriage
thread.title_full: Pastors want special session in Kentucky over gay marriage

title: Pastors want special session in Kentucky over gay marriage
text:
Pastors want special session in Kentucky over gay marriage Tuesday's meeting comes three weeks before Kentucky's election for governor. Post to Facebook Pastors want special session in Kentucky over gay marriage Tuesday's meeting comes three weeks before Kentucky's election for governor.  //on.whas11.com/1RFwid6   Pastors want special session in Kentucky over gay marriage Associated Press, @AP 2:54 p.m. EDT October 13, 2015 -same-sex-gay-marriage- CONNECT TWEET   
FRANKFORT, Ky. (AP) - Five pastors and a deacon met with Kentucky Gov. Steve Beshear's chief of staff on Tuesday to again urge the outgoing governor to accommodate Rowan County Clerk Kim Davis' wishes to not issue marriage licenses to same-sex couples. The ministers from four counties gave the governor's office a petition they said had 1,700 names on it asking the governor to call a special session of the state legislature so lawmakers could pass a law exempting Davis and others from issuing marriage licenses. 
RELATED: AG candidates wrangle over Davis case Beshear cannot run for re-election because of term limits. Beshear's chief of staff told the pastors the governor would not call a special session because it would cost too much money for an issue that only affects a few county officials. Tuesday's meeting comes three weeks before Kentucky's election for governor.  //on.whas11.com/1RFwid6 TOP VIDEOS
